page.title: 09Landscape in General
page.content: The area we had been given to investigate was chiefly rural.There were a lot of arable farms, some mixed farms, and some orchards.The farms were mainly small, compared to modern standards, and many of the farms were called Halls.Some examples are New Hall,Hannam's Hall and Brett's Hall. The available land is used intensively, and the main crops were wheat,barley,sugar beet,rape seed and peas.There was some pasture land on the mixed farms for cows and sheep. The area is largely flat, with shallow valleys, having tributaries to the Holland Brook. The two main centres of population are Tendring and Weeley.Weeley is served by British Rail, but the station was just outside our given area.Eastern National Omnibuses serve both Tendring and Weeley.
